content: Mouse, Monitor (KMM) device (USB-C connection) – Optional IBM Hardware Management Appliance feature  24-port 1 GbE Switches (two or four, depending on the system configuration)  Hardware for cable management at the rear of the system 1 For more information, see Chapter 2, Environmental specifications in IBM 3931 Installation Manual for Physical Planning, GC28-7015. Chapter 2. Central processor complex hardware components 17 An example of a fully configured system with PDU-based power, four CPC drawers, and up to 12 PCIe+ I/O drawers is shown in Figure 2-1. Figure 2-1 Maximum configuration, PDU-based powered system (front view) An example of a BPA-based powered system, and a maximum of four CPC drawers and 10 PCIe+ I/O drawers is shown in Figure 2-2. Figure 2-2 Maximum configuration, BPA-based powered system (front view) RCA RCA CPC3 I/O 13 CPC1 CPC2 CPC0 I/O 5 I/O 15 I/O 14 I/O 6 I/O 4 I/O 7 I/O 8 I/O 9 I/O 10 I/O 11 I/O 12 1-4 Frames 2 or 4 GbE Switches 2 SEs 1-4 CPCs 0-12 I/Os
